pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [dc272934ef](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15838/commits/dc272934ef6074c8881169d61d17377b234ead9d)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ofCostructuredArrowProjEquivalence`
`+ ofCostructuredArrowProjEquivalence.functor`
`+ ofCostructuredArrowProjEquivalence.inverse`
`+ ofStructuredArrowProjEquivalence`
`+ ofStructuredArrowProjEquivalence.functor`
`+ ofStructuredArrowProjEquivalence.inverse`
`++ ofDiagEquivalence`
`++ ofDiagEquivalence'`
`++ ofDiagEquivalence.functor`
`++ ofDiagEquivalence.inverse`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Is the placement of the constructions in `Over.lean` acceptable?
Also, there's versions of `ofDiagEquivalence` with `X.1` and `X.2` swapped, do we also want those? @TwoFX

> Also, there's versions of `ofDiagEquivalence` with `X.1` and `X.2` swapped, do we also want those? @TwoFX

It might be fun to deduce this by specializing your `StructuredArrow X (StructuredArrow.proj Y F) ≌ StructuredArrow Y (Under.forget X ⋙ F)` to `StructuredArrow X (Under.forget Y) ≌ StructuredArrow Y (Under.forget X)` by taking `F` to be the identity.

> It might be fun to deduce this by specializing your `StructuredArrow X (StructuredArrow.proj Y F) ≌ StructuredArrow Y (Under.forget X ⋙ F)` to `StructuredArrow X (Under.forget Y) ≌ StructuredArrow Y (Under.forget X)` by taking `F` to be the identity.

Good idea, would have tried to do it with the swap endofunctor otherwise.
@joelriou Do you think the performance of `ofDiagEquivalence'` is acceptable?

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10683740631/job/29612511853)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10683740631/job/29612512705)
This is creating data via `aesop_cat`, right? We usually try to avoid this.
It's kind of slow anyway, will replace it.

```suggestion
/-- Characterization of the costructured arrow category on the diagonal functor `T ⥤ T × T`. -/
```

It would be slightly more readable to use the following syntax:
```suggestion
    CostructuredArrow (CostructuredArrow.proj F Y) X ≌ CostructuredArrow (Over.forget X ⋙ F) Y where
  functor := sorry
  inverse := sorry
  unitIso := sorry
  counitIso := sorry
```
I would say that using `Equivalence.mk` is acceptable because it is a "smart" constructor that changes the unit and counit so that the triangle equality is automatically satisfied.
Yes, that was a conscious choice, will try if proving the triangle equality is cheap, otherwise I'd keep it this way.

All the triangle equalities are proved automatically (and the file would take a very similar amount of time to compile on my computer). In https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15919 I removed almost all the unnecessary uses of `Equivalence.mk` (and surprisingly, it made mathlib faster! I do not know how...). I do not think we should speculate about whether nobody would ever need to unfold the definitions of the (co)unit isomorphisms.
Yes, the point about is a really good one, will try to change it!
It is indeed actually faster :shrug:
Wait, isn't this still generating data using tactics? Can the `simp only` be replaced by `dsimp only` at least?
You're right.... I tried that to make it faster than just to use `Iso.refl _`... Maybe I should try to piece the iso together instead...
This change is unnecessary (the code compile without it) and problematic: one argument is that `obj_left` would no longer be triggered automatically. (Same below.)
An earlier version of the constructions below needed it, but it was a bad fix anyway since it relied on the `obj` simp having higher priority than the `obj_left` simp

I would prefer names like:
```suggestion
def ofStructuredArrowProjEquivalence.functor {D : Type u₂} [Category.{v₂} D] (F : D ⥤ T) (Y : T) (X : D) :
```
(Also, as `D` is used multiple times, it could be declared as variable by the beginning of the file.)
What would you call the inverse functors?
`ofStructuredArrowProjEquivalence.inverse`!
As this is an infix operator `<|` should be before the linebreak.

```suggestion
    StructuredArrow.mapNatIso (Under.forget X.2).rightUnitor
```

```suggestion
    CostructuredArrow.mapNatIso (Over.forget X.2).rightUnitor
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): Characterization of Structured Arrows of Diagonal and Projections
